info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 8 at 10:12PM EDT until June 9 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Edwardsport.
White River at Elliston.
Wabash River at Montezuma.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Petersburg.
White River at Hazleton.
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Rainfall amounts within the past few days of two to four inches across central Indiana is producing minor flooding along the White River as well as Wildcat Creek and Mississinewa River. Additional rainfall of up to an inch is possible through tomorrow night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Water on the shoulder and edge of SR 1 south of the junction with SR 28 in western Randolph County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Sunday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1230 PM EDT /1130 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
